page.title: 08Tourism in Gunton Area
page.content: Thousands visit Gunton Park each year, many to fish in the privately-owned lake. Others visit the unique water powered sawmill now protected by the Norfolk Windmill Trust and Norfolk Industrial Archeology Society. Gunton Church,built in 1769 by Robert Adam is maintained by the Redundant Churches Fund. Once the private chapel of the Gunton Estate, it is open to the public for viewing and for private services and concerts. The lakes are surrounded by park and woodland and attract many wild birds and animals. Visiting is restricted to protect the wild-life. The Tower, built in 1820, at the East entrance, offers fine views of the surrounding countryside and is open to the public on certain days.
